text:
As a favour - could you join this event page on LinkedIn - and invite a handful of few people to do likewise - one or two "Probables" would be fine
Basically the old adage is that "a Crowd brings a Crowd"
<https://www.linkedin.com/events/juliacon2021-freeandvirtual6746462348694958080/>

I know that LinkedIn is not everyone's favourite platform, but it is the best for corporate engagement. It would be easier to secure sponsorship when there is some momentum going in terms of PR

attachments.title: JuliaCon 2021 (free and virtual) | LinkedIn
attachments.text: Join us for the annual JuliaCon Conference. Workshops will be held the week before with more details coming later in 2021. #JuliaLang #JuliaCon #OpenSource

text: The call for papers haven't started yet?

elements.text: The call for papers haven't started yet?

text: No idea, really. I think the last year has cured us of the hubris of planning 18 months in advance.

elements.text: No idea, really. I think the last year has cured us of the hubris of planning 18 months in advance.

text: (I just had the horrible thought - what if just as we are coming out of this mess, we get hit by something like “novel Ebola virus” :scream: )

elements.text: (I just had the horrible thought - what if just as we are coming out of this mess, we get hit by something like “novel Ebola virus”

text: I figured it was becoming unlikely, but I still *really* wanted to be in Lisbon this next summer.   Any thoughts as to whether or not Lisbon will still be the likely spot for the next in-person JuliaCon (whatever year that occurs in?)

attachments.title: Save the date: JuliaCon 2021
attachments.text: Do you need volunteers? Would be glad to help.
